result.execSummary:
The defendant Darmequaye D Cohill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders restitution in the amount of $42,801.63 (count 2) to which the defendant stipulates. Payment as follows: $5085.16 payable to Somboon T. to be paid first; $37,716.47 payable to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.

EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges. Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to count 1.

Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Prior to sentencing proceeding, Atty Powell informs the court that the defendant's non-participation in the PSI interview process was due to the defendant's misunderstanding of advice of his counsel.  The court inquires if defense counsel wishes a new date to allow the defendant a chance to meet with PSI writer and the defense declines as he does not believe it would substantially change the recommendation that is in the PSI report.  Parties are prepared to proceed.  Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  The court has reviewed the numerous submissions from the victim's family. Statements by state, defense.  The defendant does not make a statement.   Additional statement by Somboon T.  Hmong interpreter Mayhoua Moua is present but services are not required.
AS TO COUNT 1:  First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, PTAC, while armed:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 15 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 379 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 10 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
AS TO COUNT 2:  First Degree Reckless Homicide, PTAC, while armed:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 60 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to count 1.  CONFINEMENT of 40 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 20 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Court orders restitution in the amount of $42,801.63(count 2) to which the defendant stipulates.  Payment as follows:  $5085.16 payable to Somboon T. to be paid first; $$37,716.47 payable to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon hee may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.
Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Credit; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Witness fee request prepared for Lenden, T. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Verdicts received and filed.

Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in court with attorneys Craig S. Powell and Michael Hart.  Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial continues.  The court is informed that the recorded statements that were to be made available to defense counsel cannot be retrieved.  A curative instruction may be given to the jury if deemed necessary.  Court conducts colloquy with the defendant as to his decision not to testify in his own behalf and finds it to be a free and voluntary decision.  Jury in the box at 9:10am.  Oral stipulation is placed on the record as to records.  Sworn for the defense: Lawrence Daniel, Digital Forensic Analyst/Consultant-Guardian Digital Forensics.  Defense rests.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  EXHIBITS 221-227 RECEIVED.  Jury out of the box at 10:20am.  Jury instructions that will be read to jury are placed on the record and stipulated to by counsels.  Jury in the box at 10:42am.  The court instructs the jury.  The court will recess for lunch and directs the jury and all parties to return at 1pm for closing arguments.  Jury out of the box at 11:10am.
All parties are present in court.  Jury in the box at 1:10pm.    Closing arguments by state and defense(Atty Powell).  Rebuttal argument by the state.  Court charged the jury.  
Jury retired at the hour of 2:30pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Lee and Spottek  who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Counsels and defendant stipulate that exhibits may be sent to jury upon request.
At the hour of 4:20pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, #4, brought in the following verdicts:
Count 1:  We, the jury, find the defendant GUILTY of First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, PTAC, and while using a dangerous weapon
Count 2:  We, the jury, find the defendant GUILTY of First Degree Reckless Homicide, PTAC, and while using a dangerous weapon
Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdicts.  Court ordered entry of judgments of conviction.
Court will order a PSI and remand the defendant pending sentencing on 1-14-2016 at 8:15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in court with attorneys Craig S. Powell and Michael Hart.  Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial continued.  Jury in the box at 9:25am.
Sworn for the state:  Tamika S.; Courtney N.; Det. Jeffrey Sullivan(MPD).  Jury out of the box at 10:45am.  Jury in the box at 11:00am.  Cross examination of Det. Sullivan resumes.  Recalled to testify: Courtney N.  Jury out of the box at 11:25am.
State will be calling Atty Reyna Morales to testify regarding former client KS. Atty Deja Vishny appears with and on behalf of Atty Morales and is moving to quash the subpoena for Atty Morales to testify.  Atty Vishny is requesting that trial be halted so that she may contact Atty Timothy Pierce of the State Bar Ethics Board for guidance on how to proceed.  There has not been a waiver of confidentiality by KS.  The court finds that there is no violation of confidentiality or privilege and will deny the request to quash the subpoena.  The court sets guidelines as to questions that may be asked of witness.  The witness will be testifying under court order.
Jury in the box at 11:40am.  Sworn for the state:  Atty Reyna Morales.  
Court recessed for lunch and directed jurors and counsels to return at 1:10pm
All parties are present in court.  Jury in the box at 1:30pm.  Sworn for the state:  Det. David Anderson(MPD); Det. Kent Corbett(MPD); Det. James Hensley(MPD); PO Matthew Truman(MPD).  Jury out of the box at 2:35pm.  Jury in the box at 3:15pm.  Sworn for the state:  Det. Erik Gulbrandson(MPD).  (EXHIBITS RECEIVED 193-199; 202; 212-214; 220)  Recalled by the state:  Det. Brad Mellenthien(MPD); Det. James Hensley(MPD).  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of the box at 4:10pm.  Sidebar regarding 'mediasolve' issue of recorded statements placed on the record.  If copy of recorded statement is available the state is to provide a copy to the defense immediately.  Defense motion to dismiss DENIED by the court.  Jury in the box at 4:25pm.  Sworn for the defense:  Lathell R.  Court will recess for the evening; court admonishes jury not to watch news media or read local paper.  All parties are to appear on 12-3-2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in court with attorneys Craig S. Powell and Michael Hart.  Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court informs counsels that juror #19 contacted the court today and advised that she is unable to return for jury service due to child care issues.  The court inquires if there is an objection to continuing the trial with the remaining 12 jurors and there is none.  The court releases the juror from further service as to this case.  Jury Management is advised.
Jury in the box at 9:15am.  Sworn for the state:  PO Alan Beattie(MPD); Leded T.; Dr. Brian Peterson, Chief Medical Examiner; Sheila W.; Det. Michael Washington(MPD).  Jury out of the box.  Jury in the box.  EXHIBITS RECEIVED: 15-48; 109-149; 191-192.
Sworn for the state:  Aaron S.; Det. Dennis DeValkenaere(MPD).  Court will recess for lunch, jury and parties are directed to return at 1:15pm.
Jury in the box at 1:25pm.  EXHIBITS RECEIVED: 49-108; 152-175; 190.  Sworn for the state:  Kyle Anderson, Firearm and Toolmark Examiner-WI State Crime Lab; Det. Robert Rehbein(MPD).  Jury out of the box 2:15pm.  Prior convictions for next witness are stipulated to by counsels (6).  Jury in the box at 2:40pm.  Sworn for the state:  Kwesen S.  Witness asserts his 5th amendment rights but states that he would not be incriminating himself if he continues to testify.  Jury out of the box at 3:15pm.  Break taken for former counsel, Jane Christopherson, to appear and speak with KS.  BACK ON THE RECORD.  Atty Christopherson places on the record the negotiations that were entered into between KS and the state as to his prior drug charges and convictions.  Witness KS informs the court that he will answer questions to the best of his ability.
Jury in the box at 4:10pm.  Cross examination of Kwesen S. resumes.  
Court releases jury for the day and admonishes them not to investigate case, do not watch local news, read the local paper or on-line.  Jury and parties are directed to return on 12-2-2015 at 9am.

Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in court with attorneys Craig S. Powell and Michael Hart.  Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:07am.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn at 11:45am.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury and recessed for lunch and directed jurors to return at 1:00pm.  Court admonished jurors not to conduct any independent investigation during the duration of this trial.
All parties are present in court at 1:00pm.  Jury in the box at 1:20pm.  Opening statements by state and defense(Atty Powell).  Trial proceeded.  
Sworn for the state: PO Travis Jung(MPD); Charlette M; PO Gerald Kulwich(MPD); Golden T; Matthew R; Det. Brad Mellenthien(MPD); Chris S.  Jury out of the box at 3:30pm.  Jury in the box at 3:45pm.  Cross-examination of Chris S.
Sworn as Hmong interpreter: Zongcheng Moua and Pahoua Xiong.  Sworn for the state:  Teng T.(via interpreter); Xiong T.(via interpreter); Suabana X.(via interpreter).  Court will recess for the evening; jury is admonished again about maintaining the integrity of the trial and directed to return at 9am on 12-1-2015.  Jury out of the box at 4:55pm.

Attorney Craig S. Powell in court, defendant Darmequaye D Cohill not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In-chambers discussion held. Case remains calendared for jury trial 11/30/15 in branch 38.

Attorney Craig S. Powell and Michael Hart in court, defendant Darmequaye D Cohill not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for Antoni Apollo for the State of Wisconsin.  Inchambers discussion held.
Case called.  There are still maps and photos that are to be provided to the defense.  There are no additional pretrial issues to be addressed prior to trial date.  The court will set another final pretrial on 11-25-2015 at 8:15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.
DEFENDANT'S WITNESS LIST.
DEFENDANT'S PROPOSED JURY INSTRUCTIONS.
Filed, Defendant's Motion In Limine

Attorney Craig S. Powell in court, defendant Darmequaye D Cohill not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance is waived.  Crime lab reports have been provided to defense.  Court is advised there are no further evidentiary issues.  Court informs counsels it has blocked the week of November 30 for this trial.  Case set for FPT on 11-3-2015.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:15 am.
STATE SUBPOENA RECALL.
RECALLED.

Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The court is informed by the state that the discovery process is progressing.  There is a joint request for an adjournment of the jury trial.  The defendant has additional charges pending so an adjournment would not prejudice the defendant or the state.
The court will grant the adjournement request.  The court will be maintaining this case post-rotation and parties are advised to report to 504 Courthouse.  Case set for final pretrial on 10-1-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 11-30-2015 at 8:15am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defense request for a pretrial conference date is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 38  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-11-2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In chambers discussion held.  Case called.  The state has been unable to retrieve the information pertaining to the miranda-goodchild issue.  Subject to obtaining this information the defendant waives a miranda-goodchild hearing.
Court will adjourn this matter to 5-7-2015 at 8:15 to allow defense to consult with its expert as to other possible trial dates.

The court will convert the trial date to Miranda-Goodchild hearing and will set a new trial date of 7-20-2015 when defense experts are available.  The court informs counsels that the trial will not be adjourned again.

Attorney Craig S. Powell in court, defendant Darmequaye D Cohill not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In chambers discussion held.  Case called.
Court will adjourn final pretrial to 4-16-15.

Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in court with attorney Craig S. Powell and Michael Hart.  Defendant Darmequaye D Cohill in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Powell advised the court that the defense still has not received all of the telephone records and that the defense has retained an out of state expert.
The court is also advised by the defense that 3 of the 4 recorded statements with MPD of the defendant are not available due to an equipment malfunction with MediaSolve.  Defense is moving to exclude those statements.
MPD Det. Matthew Bell is present and informs the court that MPD is making diligent efforts in working with MediaSolve to recover those statements as expeditiously as possible for the state and defense.
The court will set another final pretrial on 4-15-2015 at 8:15 and directs that any further motions are to be filed by 4-10-2015.  The court also states that it will not be adjourning this trial which is set on May 4, 2015.
Motion to Exclude Evidence filed by defense.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed.
